intro: Actinocephalus, commonly known as the starhead or desert star, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, star-shaped flowers. The plant thrives in hot, dry environments and has adapted to store water in its thick, fleshy stems and leaves. Its flowers, which range in color from yellow to red, bloom during the cooler months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Actinocephalus is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in low-water conditions.
